chunk_id: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0__chunk_580
source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
correct gestation  
If the ultrasound findings are in keeping with an SGA baby (current EFW < P10 OR HC/AC >2 standard 
deviations (P>97.5); OR AC < P5 if head measurements difficult for the correct gestation), further 
management can remain at a district or regional hospital.  
If not SGA on ultrasound as defined above, and the Doppler is normal, the patient can be referred back to her 
clinic. 
If the UAD is abnormal (> 95th centile) see section below on abnormal Doppler. 
SGA pregnancies are
